author: MapleSim
title: 41026 Lego Friends Sunshine Harvest
review:
Everytime a new slew of Lego Friends sets come out I pour over the pictures. It's a theme that is a hard one to explain as the go-to response is 'It's Lego for Girls". I really hate that. Lego is for boys and girls and everyone else who wants to build! Needless to say, I find this set to be the most in-the-middle gender wise, and I'll explain why in my review of the Sunshine Harvest. 

Box/Instructions

Apart from the stackability, I like the rounded edges of the Friends boxes. It draws attention to 'just another lego set' in a sea of different sized boxes. I can only assume it slightly bumps up the price though :(

 This particular one shows Olivia driving a tractor with a puppy in tow, bringing in a harvest of fruit and veggies to sell at her roadside stand. It does a good job of showing each section of the build. 

The book is standard, instructions easy enough that it should only take a half hour if you're relaxing without a schedule. 

Parts

I feel like in a fresh new marketing campaign, years along in this theme's life, they should post in big bold lettering, LOOKING FOR NEAT ARCHES OR CURVES FOR YOUR MOCs? LOOK TO LEGO FRIENDS SETS!

Seriously. In every set I've bought from this line, there are always a great collection of arche and neat round elements for building. Lots of bright colours, with this collection in particular housing some bright aqua curves used in the tractor.

I'm a sucker for anything food related in my lego, so I'm glad to report to my other foodie-fans that this set is PACKED! I'm talking printed round 1x1s with strawberries, a collection of apples and cherries, and even a carrot (with lots of extra toppers used as growing plants).

Minifigures

?We get Olivia this time around, who has been in her fair share of Lego Friends sets. Pretty standard, but we do get a puppy to tag along at her heels in her chores. It's the same one as you may have gotten in Mias' Puppy House (3934) and the Heartlake Dog Show (3942), but is a different paint job as the one you would have from Puppy's Playhouse (41025) in the Animal Series subtheme.

The build

Building itself is broken up into smaller jobs that don't connect as is mostly the norm for Friends. It's a little depressing as a fan of all kinds of themes when you compare what you make between them all, but par for the course.

The little flower basket though small is cute as a starter, and you make your way up through constructing a doghouse, garden patch, apple tree, and the Fruit Stand itself. The three end builds each have neat unique touches I've not seen before, the veggies garden as a whole is just adorable and comes together nicely, the stand has those amazing strawberry printed tiles and when built is very 3 dimensional and immersive (not flat). The Tree is probably more basic once you've built one or two along the way, but it uses a nice X plate that I've not seen used (or can remember off the top of my head) in official builds to hold the branches together.

The completed model

Honestly I love this set (and if you were fortunate like myself in getting it as part of a promotion) for the pieces alone, they are bright and colourful and really pretty unique. A good number of them are present as well.

As for the positives, I gotta give it to the display on the Fruits Stand (the arch could use some work) and the garden. both are very well done and draw you in.

Overall opinion

This theme as a whole irks me a little tiny bit more each wave, because I wish they would give us builds that had a bit more glue in them. I wish the parts in Sunshine Harvest had some way of connecting, if that's a baseplate that they share or some little scene with a pond that had some extra studs somewhere we could attach them to, I would gladly pay extra for it. 

I really dislike how the theme dumbs down building for their demographic. Each step along this build only added one or two pieces most of the time, and I fully expect that anyone, boys or girls (men or women in my case), would be capable of a bit more meat to their builds.

Mostly that's a whole other discussion.... EXCEPT; I want to give Sunshine Harvest some props.

Out of all of the Friends sets that I've built and bought, this one is a little unique, and thankfully will have some company as the newer jungle sets come out. Not only is Olivia seemingly working her own stand instead of working at a bakery or cafe, but she's doing all kinds of jobs. She's harvesting crops and tending apple trees and hauling it in and working a cash. That's a lot of work, and it bends a bit of the stereotypical gender roles which I like.

 

ENOUGH OF A RANT, this is a nice set and a decent price and a not bad price-per-brick. I reccommend!
